channel.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
channel.description:
I hate running from bat files, but since I am finally transfering to my CentOS vps, I decided to run with the bat file to see if it runs normally. I saw this: [code] Aug 04, 2013 6:52:13 PM org.rs2server.Server main INFO: Starting Hyperion... Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor at org.rs2server.util.ConfigurationParser.parse(ConfigurationParser.java :29) at org.rs2server.Server.main(Server.java:35) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.mina.core.service.IoAcce ptor at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:366) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:354) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:423) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:308) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:356) ... 2 more Press any key to continue . . . [/code] I'm not sure how to fix this.
Thanks in advice.

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:527258”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=646004.msg4344592#msg4344592 date=1375683022]
You were declaring the classpath twice
[/quote]good catch, I didnt even see that lol

@ Arham - did you modify this batch file at all or did it really come fudgeed up like that[/quote]
Besides adding the other cp no. The main problem was.

AtomicInt_:

also, you don’t add the extension of the file to the end of libs/* the asterisk indicates everything within that directory will be included.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You were declaring the classpath twice, you should have had -cp bin;lib/*; main_class

also, you don’t add the extension of the file to the end of libs/* the asterisk indicates everything within that directory will be included.

Read full topic

How the… what did you do though? O.O

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:527258”]Double check that your folder layout is like this:

-bin
-org
-rs2server
-Server.class
-lib
-mina-core-2.0.7.jar

It’s possible that your IDE is loading the jar from another location (even if your folders are correct, I’d check the project properties and double check where it is loading the jar from) using its properties and that the one in the lib folder is missing. But the important thing here is that bin and lib are on the same folder level. Probably something small wrong that I am just not spotting[/quote]
Its all correct however. My IDE is loading from my libs folder.

[quote=“Jmood, post:9, topic:527258”]Using Batch files on CentOS seems correct.

EDIT: Just wondering why you would have both pause and exit. Did you try and redownload the library?[/quote]
Yes I did.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Using Batch files on CentOS seems correct.

EDIT: Just wondering why you would have both pause and exit. Did you try and redownload the library?

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Double check that your folder layout is like this:

-bin
-org
-rs2server
-Server.class
-lib
-mina-core-2.0.7.jar

It’s possible that your IDE is loading the jar from another location (even if your folders are correct, I’d check the project properties and double check where it is loading the jar from) using its properties and that the one in the lib folder is missing. But the important thing here is that bin and lib are on the same folder level. Probably something small wrong that I am just not spotting

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Davidi2:

-cp is a relative reference, please post your entire batch file (especially if there is a cd anywhere)

@echo off
title Hyperion
"C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.7.0_21/bin/java.exe" -cp lib/mina-core-2.0.7.jar;lib/*.jar; -cp bin; org.rs2server.Server
pause
exit

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:527258”]If you were running it with an IDE before, it was probably adding the MINA jar to the classpath in its own way through the projects properties. This means you need to add the jar to the classpath in your batch file as well using the command line arguments. This is assuming MINA is packaged as a jar, to be honest I’ve never even downloaded it. If it’s not and it’s just files you want to make sure that the class files are where the project thinks they are (sometimes a bin folder).

You add the jar to the classpath for one program with
-cp path/to/jar.jar
As an argument after ‘java’ in the batch file. If you are sure you have done that correctly, can you paste your run.bat? Hard to see the issue without looking at it.

If you did do the batch properly, it probably does actually mean it cant see the file. Either you forgot to copy it over, the class is missing from the jar, etc.[/quote]

-cp lib/mina-core-2.0.7.jar

I had done that.

It runs perfectly fine on the IDE however.

Read full topic

item.title: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/mina/core/ service/IoAcceptor
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If you were running it with an IDE before, it was probably adding the MINA jar to the classpath in its own way through the projects properties. This means you need to add the jar to the classpath in your batch file as well using the command line arguments. This is assuming MINA is packaged as a jar, to be honest I’ve never even downloaded it. If it’s not and it’s just files you want to make sure that the class files are where the project thinks they are (sometimes a bin folder).

You add the jar to the classpath for one program with
-cp path/to/jar.jar
As an argument after ‘java’ in the batch file. If you are sure you have done that correctly, can you paste your run.bat? Hard to see the issue without looking at it.

If you did do the batch properly, it probably does actually mean it cant see the file. Either you forgot to copy it over, the class is missing from the jar, etc.

Read full topic

You’re library isn’t included.

lib/*.jar

Aug 04, 2013 6:52:13 PM org.rs2server.Server main

I’m not sure how to fix this.
